event.title: was incorporated as a borough by the Pennsylvania General Assembly on March 27, 1887

data.event: Montgomery was incorporated as a borough by the Pennsylvania General Assembly on March 27, 1887 from part of Clinton Township.
The history of the settlement of Montgomery begins in 1783 when John Lawson established a homestead there.

event.title: built a gristmill in Montgomery in 1795

data.event: Nicholas Shaffer built a gristmill in Montgomery in 1795.
He opened a distillery in 1859 and later a planing mill in 1869 on the site of the distillery.

event.title: laid out a town around their mill in 1870

data.event: Barber with his partners, A.B. Henderson, Jesse Rank, and Nathan Fowler had so much success that they laid out a town around their mill in 1870.

data.event: The town was further expanded by the success of Montgomery Machine Shops which starting in 1873, under the supervision of Levi Houston, built woodworking machinery that was sold to clients throughout the United States and Canada and as far away as Australia.
